I have another idea for hubs like ZeroMe. totally unrelated to our discussion.
Instead of loading via public key and the signed data of the owner of the key;
Imagine the data being hashed, and the hash of the Data is the link of the site.

for example look at this data structure:

site0 = {
Original site described
genesis hash = 0
intro: ZeroMe, a dec social network.
original author: author0 = {public key, data about the author}
source and content: html, css, json, js (I'll call this package as 'content' hereafter.)
} –> produce hash0

now the author wants to update the content. makes new site:

site1 = {
previous hash = hash0
no intro
current author: author0
updated content
} –> produce hash1, sign by author0 key, inject to the network

updates happen and site reaches site(n-1).
now imagine the author loses the key, dies, or ends the project, etc.
many people are still on the network.
here author01 comes to play

site(n) = {
previous hash = hash(n-1)
current author: author1 = {public key, data about the author}
updated content
} –> produce hash(n)

suggest the update to the structure of ZeroMe to the whole network.
since the update is needed, and no one has been around for a while,
the network is large enough to investigate the update and vote for it.
the site for the whole time has been hash0 instead of a public key. 
So people can migrate to hash(n) and the network and history of hash0 won't be lost.
from here on link of the website will be hash(n) instead of a public key.
The network can split in this method.
I call this method consensusHash.

__________________________________________________________________________

Another suggestion is that site0 gets at least 10 authors. If 60% of authors agree to a change and sign it, the update will be injected to the network.
In this way if more than 40% of the authors discontinue their work the site would die.
Problem of disagreement amongst owners exists. It'll be like a senate.
The link would be hash0 for the whole time.
Owners list can be updated during a voting.
I call this method senateHash.

__________________________________________________________________________

This gives meaning to the life of Data, instead of Data being dependent on Authors keys.
Data will evolve to a BlockTree.

What do you think?
